item.title: Not enough benefit to offer all teens Covid jabs
item.description: But a larger group of 12-15 year olds with underlying conditions will get the vaccine.

item.title: New Zealand PM Ardern says supermarket stabbing was 'terrorist attack'
item.description: Videos circulating online show panicked shoppers running out of a supermarket in Auckland.

item.title: National Insurance: Minister refuses to deny reports of tax hike for social care
item.description: The justice secretary says social care must be properly funded but declines to "speculate" on plans.

item.title: Storm Ida: Before and after images of north-east devastation
item.description: Before and after satellite images of the devastation caused by Storm Ida in the north-east US.

item.title: Storm Ida aftermath: 'I can't even count my losses from the flooding right now'
item.description: Residents in the US north-east assess the scale of the devastation caused by Tropical Storm Ida.

item.title: EU and AstraZeneca reach deal to end vaccine row
item.description: AstraZeneca agrees to deliver 200 million doses by next spring, ending the threat of court action.

item.title: Afghanistan: Leaked document warns of refugee funding shortfall
item.description: Resettling eligible Afghans over the next 10 years could cost more than £2.5bn, a leaked document says.

item.title: Arrest after woman falls to death from Arthur's Seat
item.description: A 31-year-old woman died at the scene after the cliff fall in Edinburgh at about 21:00 on Thursday evening.

item.title: Birmingham dancing thief's 'fancy footwork' caught on camera
item.description: Police describe Abdelhadi Bahou Jabour's moves as "part Bruce Forsyth, part Artful Dodger".

item.title: Man, 86, died in Bude Canal saving disabled daughter
item.description: Lawrence Casey's family say "his final act of love" was to "sacrifice his life to save hers".

item.title: 'Abba saved 2021' - why the Swedish band have not gone out of fashion
item.description: Forty years after their last album, a new generation of fans is hungry for the pop legends' music.

item.title: Partially-shredded Banksy back under the hammer at Sotheby's
item.description: The artwork, re-titled Love Is In The Bin, will appear at a Sotheby's auction in October.

item.title: Student spends 400 days in hospital recovering from 2020 car crash
item.description: Macy, 21, tells Newsbeat how she stays positive after 400 days in hospital from a car crash in 2020.

item.title: How North Korea’s founding father, Kim Il-sung, came to power
item.description: Professor Kim Hyung-suk had breakfast with the man who would rule North Korea for nearly 50 years

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Baking boom saw them fighting over my flour'
item.description: Nigel Moon, 69, has dedicated much of his life to restoring and running Whissendine Windmill.

item.title: Paddle boarder's close encounter with two curious whales
item.description: A drone filmed what the paddle boarder, out on the water on her birthday, calls a "magical moment".

item.title: Drake credits The Beatles on Certified Lover Boy
item.description: Lennon and McCartney get a writing credit on the star's new album, which came out at midnight.

item.title: Bristol's Love Saves the Day and Idles attracts crowds of 60,000
item.description: Bristol's Team Love describe the past 18 months as they plan for 60k people on The Downs this weekend.

item.title: Coin hoarding at home leads to charity plea
item.description: UK residents are hoarding an estimated £50m in loose change, according to UK Finance.

item.title: Prince Andrew, Bob Dylan, Catholic priests and the Child Victims Act
item.description: Prince Andrew, Bob Dylan, Catholic priests and others face suits after a change in New York law.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Paralympic dream that started at the supermarket
item.description: Aruba had never had a Paralympic team until a student in her 20s decided to make it happen.

item.title: How Europe turned sour on Joe Biden
item.description: In many EU circles, the honeymoon period for Donald Trump's successor may be coming to an end.

item.title: Shang-Chi: Why Marvel's first Asian superhero is empowering change
item.description: Shang-Chi And The Legend Of The Ten Rings sees Simu Liu front an Asian-led cast. Why does it matter?

item.title: 'I'm living my childhood dream as a theme park designer'
item.description: Bitten by the funfair bug when just three in Aberdeen, Iona Jost now works in America designing attractions.

item.title: How to back up your data and keep it safe
item.description: Experts recommend using three drives to back up your data and using cloud-based services.

item.title: Molly-Mae: 'I’m not just an influencer any more'
item.description: The former Love Island contestant is taking on a new job as a creative director in fashion.

item.title: Driver shortage: 'I got a big pay rise overnight'
item.description: As the UK's shortage of lorry drivers continues, those with the right skills are very much in demand.

item.title: Universal credit £20 drop: 'I'm used to hunger pains'
item.description: Under 25s are losing the biggest percentage of their income when the payments go down in October.

item.title: Afghanistan: Councils prepare to offer homes to refugees
item.description: The UK has promised to resettle 20,000 Afghan refugees. Where will they live?

item.title: Canada federal election: How much trouble is Trudeau in?
item.description: Canada's leader called a snap election, but midway through the campaign his party is struggling.

item.title: Covid: Mixed emotions as pupils return to school across England
item.description: Parents have contrasting feelings as safety measures in schools are eased at the start of the new year.

item.title: Why picking a good company name is a tricky business
item.description: With the number of new start-ups soaring they all have to choose a name for themselves.

item.title: Children's internet code: What is it and how will it work?
item.description: The ICO's Children's Code will make technology companies reassess how they offer services to children.

item.title: Hamilton breaks down as Leclerc fastest in Dutch GP practice
item.description: Charles Leclerc leads a Ferrari one-two in Dutch Grand Prix second practice while Lewis Hamilton misses most of the session.

item.title: Teenage boxer dies after knockout
item.description: Mexican welterweight boxer Jeanette Zacarias Zapata, 18, dies five days after being knocked out in a fight.

item.title: British teenager Raducanu reaches US Open third round
item.description: British teenager Emma Raducanu delivers another impressive display as she sweeps aside China's Zhang Shuai to reach the US Open third round.

item.title: Fifa investigates racist abuse of England players in Hungary
item.description: Fifa is investigating racial abuse aimed at England players during Thursday's 4-0 win over Hungary in a World Cup qualifier in Budapest.

item.title: England v India: Mohammed Siraj traps Jonny Bairstow lbw for 37
item.description: India's Mohammed Siraj piles the pressure on England by removing Jonny Bairstow lbw for 37 during the fourth Test against India at the Oval.

item.title: Football Focus: Everton's Izzy Christiansen & Lucy Graham say WSL now 'on another level'
item.description: Football Focus meets Everton's Izzy Christiansen and Lucy Graham before the Women's Super League season, which they say will be "on another level".

item.title: England v India: Ollie Pope hits Shardul Thakur for three fours in an over
item.description: India's Shardul Thakur bowls an expensive over as Ollie Pope hits him for three fours, with another delivery resulting in four leg byes.

item.title: Afghanistan women's cricket team: Players hiding in Kabul fear Taliban rule
item.description: Members of Afghanistan's women's cricket team are hiding in Kabul, fearing for their safety following the Taliban's return to power.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban parade captured equipment in Kandahar
item.description: The militant group showcased the kit captured during their takeover of Afghanistan.

item.title: Kabul make-up artist: 'Women like me are Taliban targets'
item.description: A make-up artist in hiding explains how much Afghanistan's beauty industry has meant to women.

item.title: Afghanistan: How many asylum seekers has the UK taken in?
item.description: The UK government says it will resettle up to 20,000 Afghan refugees, but warns it will 'take time'.

item.title: Afghanistan: Joe Biden speech on withdrawal fact-checked
item.description: How consistent is President Biden in his comments on Afghanistan following the final US troop withdrawal?

item.title: Afghanistan: How can the West stop terror bases?
item.description: The foreign secretary says the UK will fight ISIS-K by all means available - but what does that mean?

item.title: Afghanistan: Rescued animals 'in amazing condition' in UK
item.description: Most of the 150 animals rescued by "Pen" Farthing's charity are to be adopted by veterans.

item.title: Amid violent reprisals, Afghans fear the Taliban's 'amnesty' was empty
item.description: Reports suggest the Taliban are searching for, and allegedly killing, people they pledged to leave in peace.

item.title: Female journalist who interviewed Taliban flees
item.description: Beheshta Arghand, who made headlines when she interviewed the Taliban, has spoken out after fleeing the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Struggle to survive or race to escape' on streets of Kabul
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from the Afghan capital, a day after the last US troops left.

item.title: Afghanistan: UK embassy told Afghans to go to Abbey Gate before suicide attack
item.description: Despite an attack being expected, emails seen by the BBC show embassy staff directing Afghans to the gate.

item.title: Taliban are back - what next for Afghanistan?
item.description: As the Taliban take power after 20 years of conflict, what did the war achieve and what happens now?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Great Britain win three golds and pass 100-medal mark
item.description: Great Britain win three more golds on day 10 and pass the 100-medal mark at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Who are Great Britain's medal winners?
item.description: A list of the Great Britain medal winners from the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics.

item.title: Which country has won most golds?
item.description: Which country is leading the medal table for the Tokyo 2020 Paralympics? How are Great Britain getting on?

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: What you need to know about Paralympic classification
item.description: From KL1 to PT2 and F11 to SB6 - everything you need to know about classification at the Paralympic Games.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Sport-by-sport guide
item.description: Twenty-two sports will feature in the Tokyo Paralympics - find out more about them all here.

item.title: Sarah Storey says her 17th Paralympic gold 'feels like an out of body experience'
item.description: Britain's Sarah Storey says she "feels immensely proud" to have won a record 17 Paralympic gold medals and is hoping to add more at Paris 2024.

item.title: Shot putter stripped of gold - for being three minutes late
item.description: Muhammad Ziyad Zolkefli won his shot put event but had his title revoked because he was three minutes late.

item.title: Ellie Simmonds says Paralympic career is over after missing out on medal
item.description: Ellie Simmonds says her Paralympic career is at an end after missing out on a medal in her final race of the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Smith retains individual Paralympic boccia title
item.description: Britain's David Smith likens himself to footballer Cristiano Ronaldo as he retains his Paralympic boccia individual title.

item.title: Becky Redfern: The 'tough ride' to becoming a Paralympic silver medallist
item.description: Becky Redfern said it was "an incredible feeling" to win Paralympic bronze in the SB13 100m breaststroke, just over a year after giving birth to her first child.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Gordon Reid and Alfie Hewett reach semi-finals
item.description: Defending champion Gordon Reid and Rio silver medallist Alfie Hewett both made it into to the men's singles semi-finals.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Afghanistan athlete Hossain Rasouli makes debut after evacuation
item.description: Afghanistan evacuee Hossain Rasouli finally gets his chance to compete at the Tokyo Paralympics - and his opponents can't "help but feel joy".

item.title: Afghanistan: Shukria Barakzai's whispered voice notes and dramatic escape
item.description: The desperate messages sent by Afghan politician Shukria Barakzai to a UK MP as the Taliban tried to hunt her down.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'undefeated' Panjshir Valley - an hour from Kabul
item.description: The Panjshir Valley has been a flashpoint in Afghanistan's turbulent history - now it's happening again.

item.title: Bilal Sarwary: 'The plane hit the tower and all our lives changed'
item.description: Afghan journalist Bilal Sarwary was selling carpets when 9/11 happened. From that day on, everything changed.

item.title: Shot in the head in Angola, left for dead, now a Wetherspoons star
item.description: Cesar Kimbirima fled Angola after being shot four times and spending five months in a coma.

item.title: Michael Knighton: The man who could have bought Man Utd for £10m but walked away
item.description: In August 1989, Michael Knighton celebrated his Manchester United takeover deal at Old Trafford. But the plotting against him had just begun.
